org.lightsleep.helper

Class Accessor<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lightsleep.helper.Accessor<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of target object.

    public class Accessor<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Gets and sets value for fields of objects.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Masato Kokubo

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Accessor(java.lang.Class<T> objectClass)
      Constructs a new Accessor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.reflect.Field getField(java.lang.String propertyName)
      Returns the Field object of the fields that are specified by propertyName.
      java.lang.Class<?> getType(java.lang.String propertyName)
      Returns the type of the field that are specified by propertyName.
      java.lang.Object getValue(T object, java.lang.String propertyName)
      Returns a value of the field of the specified object.
      If the field is public, gets the value directly, otherwise uses the public getting method related to the the field.
      If the field name is foo, getting method is one of the following.
      foo() getFoo() isFoo()
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> propertyNames()
      Returns a list of property names of accessible all fields.
      If not nested, the property name is the same as the field name.
      void setValue(T object, java.lang.String propertyName, java.lang.Object value)
      Sets a value to the field of the specified object.
      If the field is public, sets the value directly, otherwise uses the public setting method related to the the field.
      If the field name is foo, setting method is one of the following.
      foo() setFoo()
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> valuePropertyNames()
      Returns a list of property names of the accessible value type of the field.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Accessor

        public Accessor(java.lang.Class<T> objectClass)
        Constructs a new Accessor.
        Parameters:
        objectClass - the class of access target object
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if objectClass is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if objectClass is interface

    • Method Detail

      • propertyNames

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> propertyNames()
        Returns a list of property names of accessible all fields.
        If not nested, the property name is the same as the field name. Otherwise, it is the name that connected each field with a period. (e.g. name.first)
        Returns:
        a list of property names

      • valuePropertyNames

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> valuePropertyNames()
        Returns a list of property names of the accessible value type of the field. If not nested, the property name is the same as the field name. Otherwise, it is the name that connected each field with a period. (e.g. name.first)
        Value type is one of the following.
         
        boolean, char, byte, short, int, long, float, double,
        Boolean, Character, Byte, Short, Integer, Long, Float, Double, BigInteger, BigDecimal,
        String, java.util.Date, java.sql.Date, Time, Timestamp
        Returns:
        the list of the property names

      • getField

        public java.lang.reflect.Field getField(java.lang.String propertyName)
        Returns the Field object of the fields that are specified by propertyName.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - a property name
        Returns:
        the Field object
        Throws:
        MissingPropertyException - if the field that are specified by propertyName dose not exist

      • getType

        public java.lang.Class<?> getType(java.lang.String propertyName)
        Returns the type of the field that are specified by propertyName.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - a property name
        Returns:
        the type
        Throws:
        MissingPropertyException - if the field that are specified by propertyName dose not exist

      • getValue

        public java.lang.Object getValue(T object,
                                 java.lang.String propertyName)
        Returns a value of the field of the specified object.
        If the field is public, gets the value directly, otherwise uses the public getting method related to the the field.
        If the field name is foo, getting method is one of the following.
        • foo()
        • getFoo()
        • isFoo()
        Parameters:
        object - an object
        propertyName - the property name of the field
        Returns:
        a value (might be null)
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if object is null
        MissingPropertyException - if the get method for the field that are specified by propertyName dose not exist
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if IllegalAccessException was thrown

      • setValue

        public void setValue(T object,
                     java.lang.String propertyName,
                     java.lang.Object value)
        Sets a value to the field of the specified object.
        If the field is public, sets the value directly, otherwise uses the public setting method related to the the field.
        If the field name is foo, setting method is one of the following.
        • foo()
        • setFoo()
        Parameters:
        object - an object
        propertyName - the property name of the field
        value - a value to be set the field (permit null)
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if object is null
        MissingPropertyException - if the set method for the field that are specified by propertyName does not exist
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if IllegalAccessException or InvocationTargetException was thrown
